answers.answer: And to think you were scared a few days ago:  she was so worth it, right?Congratulations, the best for you!
YAY!!!!!!!!!!!! Pot of gold at the end of the rainbow, right?! She sounds like a doll! I'm going to go look at pics now!
congratulations!!!  glad to hear things went well!
many  congratulations... very cuteeee princess. welldone and enjoyyyy

question: Hey all, sorry it took me so long to update.  So, I went in at 6:00am Wednesday morning, and Adriana Michelle was born via c-section  at 8:55am.  She was 7lbs 13oz, and 19 in long.  She is the ONLY baby out of the three that was breathing and crying as soon as she came out.  it was the best sound ever.  My c-section  this time was a bit rough.  They didn't let my husband in during the spinal, which I didn't like.  Also, they gave me a shot of ephedrine before my surgery so my blood pressure wouldn't drop, but my heart was beating so fast, the feeling was horrible.  it seems that I had almost every bad reaction to the spinal.  Within minutes I was throwing up, then shaking, then itching...and the shaking and itching continued for quite some time after.,.but that was oik, it was def. worth it.  The doctors had commended me on how well I must have taken care of myself(I had gestational diabetes), because she came out so perfect...perfect weight, perfectly breathing, perfect blood sugars.....I really had expected things to get a little hairy, but nope...I am so happy and she is such a good baby.  She came out with a headfull of dark hair which I WAS NOT expecting.  She looks like me, which is so great.  I am posting some pictures of her after i post this, so everyone go take a look at my little princess.  Thanks for all the support!!!
title: I'm back!!!  Adriana Michelle is here!!!!
